messages.message: @vivek.prakash has a few question papers. I have this basic example where we aren't correctly identifying the hypotenuse.
chart examples from powerpoint decks for startups are more relevant

I don't have any of those handy but here are some interesting examples from public sources. Termina (a16z) was super interested in this capability.
• Dropbox - Dropbox: $15K VC investment turned into $16.8B. Dropbox's initial pitch deck | PPT (slideshare.net) (https://www.slideshare.net/DanielChadorhany/dropbox-15k-of-vc-investment-turned-into-17b-dropboxs-initial-pitch-deck)
• FB - Facebook Pitch Deck | PPT (slideshare.net) (https://www.slideshare.net/startuphome/facebook-pitch-deck-87761364)
• Wework :skull: - WeWork Pitch Deck 2014 | PPT (slideshare.net)  (https://www.slideshare.net/startuphome/wework-pitch-deck-2014-87805942)- eg: give me revenue/ebidta ratio for each yet

Extract the company name, scope 1 direct emissions, scope 2 location-based emissions, and unit of measurement for emissions for 2021 total. This report also includes 2022 UK, Overseas and Total data in the table, but ignore those figures and report figures only from "2021 total". Return strictly as JSON with the headings: Company name, Scope 1 (direct emissions), Scope 2 (location-based), unit of emissions. This should report on actual performance, rather than specific to a particular line of business. Convert the output into mt (CO2e million tonnes), and output to 3 DP.

The data is on page 26 in the chart on the left, which it can just about extract, but can get wrong
